kind.description: Describes the type of resource. e.g. ingress, application, mysql etc. If not specified, fallback is the `folder_name`/instances

flavor.description: Implementation selector for the resource. e.g. for a resource type ingress, default, aws_alb, gcp_alb etc.

version.description: This field can be used to pin to a particular version

lifecycle.description: This field describes the phase in which the resource has to be invoked (`ENVIRONMENT_BOOTSTRAP`)

conditional_on_intent.description: Flag to enable the resource based on intent availability. eg mysql if mysql dashboard is required to be deployed. Note: Need to have the instance running beforehand to avail.

provided.description: Flag to tell if the resource should not be provisioned by facets

depends_on.description: Dependencies on other resources. e.g. application x may depend on mysql

name.description:
Name of the resource
    - if not specified, fallback is the `filename`

spec.description: Specification as per resource types schema

out.description: Output given by the resource for others to refer.

advanced.description: Additional fields if any for a particular implementation of a resource

allowed_triggers.description: Map of allowed triggers to create Lambda permission

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: This is the name of the output interface this can be any name depending on the number of prefix domains in the domains block

source_arn.description: When the principal is an AWS service, the ARN of the specific resource within that service to grant permission to. Without this, any resource from principal will be granted permission â€“ even if that resource is from another account. For S3, this should be the ARN of the S3 Bucket. For EventBridge events, this should be the ARN of the EventBridge Rule. For API Gateway, this should be the ARN of the API, as described here.

action.description: The AWS Lambda action you want to allow in this statement.

principal.description: The principal who is getting this permission e.g., s3.amazonaws.com, an AWS account ID, or AWS IAM principal, or AWS service principal such as events.amazonaws.com or sns.amazonaws.com

source_account.description: his parameter is used when allowing cross-account access, or for S3 and SES. The AWS account ID (without a hyphen) of the source owner.

event_source_token.description: The Event Source Token to validate. Used with Alexa Skills.

statement_id.description: A unique statement identifier. By default generated by Terraform.

aws_lambda_permission.description: The advanced section of all the aws lambda permission module

out.description: The output for your aws lambda permission module, this can be generated or provided

attributes.description: The advanced section of all the aws lambda module
